prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Slightly Tapered Top and Bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [-0.05, 0.75, -0.02] Next, create a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a single circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.35, 0.35] - Radius: 0.35 After creating the circle, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [-0.05, 0.75, -0.02] Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.7 - Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top and Bottom Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0695, 0.0, 0.05] Next, create a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw six faces, each with a single loop consisting of lines and/or arcs, as follows: - Face 1: One loop with four lines. - Face 2: One loop with four lines. - Face 3: One loop with one arc and four lines. - Face 4: One loop with one circle. - Face 5: One loop with one circle. - Face 6: One loop with four lines. Ensure that all loops are closed, and no loop contains both a line and a circle or an arc and a circle. After creating the sketch, do not scale it. Then, transform the sketch into 3D using the same Euler angles and translation vector as the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.75 - Sketch scale: 0.56 - Operation: Cut material from the existing body</description>
